security: This document reveals details of CIA support for anti-Castro Cuban exile groups, including financial aid, training camps, and coordination of activities. It also names individuals involved in these operations, potentially endangering them or compromising ongoing intelligence efforts. Specifically, the document states: "CIA at the direction of 'Special Group' had been furnishing support to the MRR and its leader, Manuel Artime, and had been maintaining liaison with him on a regular basis. CIA dis- claimed control over the MRR and Artime."
summary: This FBI document details the activities of Manuel Artime and the MRR (Movimiento Revolucionario Recuperacion), a Cuban exile group, including CIA support, training camps, raids on Cuba, and internal conflicts. It covers the period from 1960 to 1964, highlighting Artime's role as a key figure in the anti-Castro movement and the involvement of various individuals and organizations.
summary_one_paragraph: This FBI document, dated August 11, 1967, summarizes information gathered between 1960 and 1964 concerning Manuel Artime and the MRR, a Cuban exile group involved in anti-Castro activities. The report details CIA support for the MRR, including financial aid and training camps in Central America, as well as Artime's travels and recruitment efforts. It also covers the MRR's internal conflicts, its raids on Cuba, and the relationships between Artime, Brigade 2506, and other exile leaders. The document references various sources, including confidential informants and press reports, to provide a comprehensive overview of the MRR's activities and Artime's role within the Cuban exile community.
title: FBI Report on Manuel Artime and Cuban Exile Activities
persons_mentioned: Francisco Gualberto Cajigas y Garcia Del Prado
